subject: Re: An "after all tests" event
msgSnippet: Cedric, That is what you get out of @BeforeClass and @AfterClass when you define them on the class with the @RunWith(Suite.class) annotation. It is the same
messageBody:
Cedric,

That is what you get out of @BeforeClass and @AfterClass when you define them on the class with the @RunWith(Suite.class) annotation. It is the same effect.

Yishai

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, CÃ©dric Beust â" <cbeust@...> wrote:
